summary: The TerminatedFailure object is missing a 'details' field that is available on the WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes and accepted by the terminate API. This inconsistency prevents users from accessing termination details.
userImpact: Users cannot access termination details when a workflow is terminated, limiting their ability to understand and handle termination events properly.
rootCause: The TerminatedFailureInfo proto definition in the core API is missing the details field that exists in WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.
proposedFix: Add details field to TerminatedFailureInfo proto definition in temporalio/api repository and update WorkflowHandle.terminate to accept and pass through termination arguments.
keyQuote: terminate accepts "details", which are present on WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes even though they aren't present on TerminatedFailureInfo.
